Welcome to Mech Sheets! This app does not include any record sheets directly - instead the app reads "MTF" files - which are available from the excellent free PC Game called MegaMek. A link to their page is below. To get started, I have tried to simplify the process from the older version:\n\n
To get started, you will first need to download MegaMek (the Development version for Windows) - note that MegaMek is approx 600Mb in size, which means if you are downloading on your device you may incur data charges, please check with your provider!!
\nIt is recommended to first download on a PC!\n

Once downloaded, you have 3 options:


1) You can simply copy the entire file to your phone if you have space, and use the "Import from MegaMek" option. This is the easiest, but also the slowest. It will take awhile and your device may appear to stop responding. Just wait for it to finish, it should take no more than a few minutes. Once done you will be able to choose a mech from the list.


2) To save space and time, inside the MegaMek.zip file is a "mechs.zip" file - if you extract just that file and copy to your phone, Use the "Import Multiple Mechs" option for this much faster process.


3) Finally, you can also extract the individual MTF files or if you have some customized or from other sources, import them directly using "Import Single Mech". This is the same functionality as the older 1.3 version of Mech Sheets.


For the first 2 options, once done you will see a list of mechs you can use. Simply tap on any of them to add them to Mech Sheets and get playing!
This shows the overview of your unit. As leg or jump jet damage occurs, the Walk/Run/Jump values will turn red and be reduced. You can also edit the name of the unit to anything you like.

Weapons and equipment can be tapped on to help you remember what weapons you are firing. If a weapon is destroyed, it will show a different color.\n\n Note: At this time Mech Sheets cannot determine with 100%% accuracy which item was destroyed. For example if you have 2 identical weapons that take up 3 spaces each, and 2 components are damaged, Mech Sheets cannot determine if its one weapon destroyed, or 2. Tapping [ALL] will either select or deselect all weapons.
Each ton of ammo appears as a button that you can click on each time the weapon is fired.
As heat sinks are destroyed, the remaining heat sinks counter will adjust and will turn red. Use the Heat Scale to track how much heat the mech currently has.
use this to include any other information you wish to track

Here you can adjust the pilots skills up or down, as well as any hits they may have taken. As they take more hits, the color will change. You can also change the default name to something more appropriate
Choosing a color here will adjust the Pilot icon in the list of Units - useful to quickly associate different units to different teams

When a mech takes damage, use this screen to record damage to each locations armor and internal structure.


Tapping on a location will bring up the Damage Popup. Here you can tap on a button to automatically set the damage to that, or if you prefer use the plus / minus buttons to fine tune the amount of damage taken.


When a location such as an arm or leg is destroyed, additional damage taken will transfer to the next logical location (torso) automatically. Components will also automatically be destroyed as locations are destroyed.

When a mech takes critical damage, use this screen to record damage to each component that is hit.\n\n When a component is destroyed, it will affect the Overview screen - for example destroying a weapon here will change its color indicating it might be destroyed in the Overview screen, and damaging a leg will reduce it\'s indicated speed. When a component is destroyed, the color will change to red.
